title: Doorman
text: Dino = excellent doorman! Very helpful with luggage and rides to EWR. Rooms were nice I was expecting a little more, also $9.80 for a Lemonade in the lobby is crazy. Luckily it’s self checkout so I only paid for one. But otherwise a great trip and this closes out my 200 characters.

title: A lovely stay - thank you!
text: We had a fantastic stay! The hotel is new and in perfect condition. Rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are big! Staff is very nice and helpful, especially Minhaj helped kindly and swiftly whenever needed. Also Shai was very kind and helpful, thank you!

title: AMAZING
text: AMAZING! Wonderful staff from lobby security to maid service.LOVED our bartender Karina. Bell men Deano, Van and Migual were fabulous. We will definitely be back! Thank you for a great stay my first time in New York!! Sarah from Montana Thank you

title: Excellent hotel, highly recommend
text: Everything here was top notch. Right in times square but has been built to muffle the sound so I didn't have any trouble sleeping. The room has excellent controls for lights and curtains, the shower had excellent water pressure and everything was spotless. The room was very well laid out and not missing anything. The staff were all kind and pleasant especially housekeeping, bellmen, and doormen. I hate times square but have to be there for work so will definitely be staying here again.

title: Average hotel but in prime location
text:
An average hotel in the heart of times square. I was expecting more from a Hilton 4* hotel but it fell short in a few areas that could be easily rectified. 

Positives: check in was quick and easy, central times square, transport links nearby (subway), friendly staff, modern hotel, nice bar (but expensive), towels changed daily (although I don't mind reusing to be eco-friendly - this didn't seem to be an option even when towels were hung they were changed regardless), room was clean and well presented

Negatives: 19th floor - very noisy even at night, no water provided - can drink tap water but there were no glasses/cups even in bathroom, no mini bar, light switches/ blinds didn't always work first time, room was a lot smaller than I imagined it to be, there was a massive gap between the wall and the curtains shutting - bright lights constantly coming through at night
Be aware that there is a daily surcharge at this hotel that adds up very quickly.

title: Best time ever
text: This has been the best place ever. All staff is wonderful! The bellmen were very helpful. It has been amazing. We especially like Karina the bartender. She is amazing and friendly. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to NY. Thank you! Thank you!! Thank you!!!

title: Awesome experience!
text: Amazing location, service, and quality! We were very pleased with our stay and the staff assisted us in every way possible! Very nice rooms! Lots of restaurants close, and within walking distance of many NYC attractions. Right in the heart of Time Square!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
The hotel is well located, good service, clean and a cozy atmosphere. 
You saw her from the full room to Time Square. The hotel is completely clean and the employees are very attentive like Yassin. He always greets us with a smile and always answers our questions.

title: Family friendly Times Square stay
text: From check in to check out the experience at Tempo by Hilton was absolutely amazing. The view from the 42nd floor was amazing the room was clean and beds super comfortable. The bathroom was aesthetically pleasing and the housekeeping crew kept it all in check throughout our stay. My family and I were very pleased , we were actually booked at another hotel and had to change hotels immediately and I found Tempo which I am so happy I did. The staff is so attentive and helpful they make sure your stay is a breeze and help in any way that they can. Bo at check in as such great customer service she ensured we were good every step of the way, checking in and out was quick and easy. I was super impressed with the security team also they are attentive to the guests and pay keen attention to who is coming in and out , they also help out with any need whether it be transportation or simply somewhere good to grab a bite to eat. The hotel has a restaurant but food options were limited , entrees aren’t served with sides and the food items are a bit pricey with lack of side options to be added. You have a better bet of getting food off property. Big up to Yassin on the security team , he was so helpful also Miguel and Juan who arranged transportation. We really enjoyed our stay, felt like home and we will definitely be back soon.

title: We look forward to returning
text: 5/5 for location, comfort and staff. We spent a long weekend there and were surprised at the room size for a Times Square hotel. It was fairly spacious, had 2 incredibly comfy beds and a wonderful bathroom - but with a sliding bathroom door that didn't stay closed and couldn't be locked. The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful. We loved the number of elevators and how quickly they operated. The hotel is immediately across the street from a big Hersey's store and an easy walk to Broadway shows and shopping and the subway staircase is immediately outside the hotel. We stayed on the 36th floor. With the window closed, we could not hear any of the Times Square chaos and we loved that we had a choice of blinds to use including blackout for a great sleep.

title: All perfect
text:
Modern hotel in the center of Time Square. Structure equipped with every comfort. Spacious and spotlessly clean rooms equipped with a coffee machine, safe and numerous sockets everywhere, including USB ones, so as not to require travel adapters.
The hairdryer available is professional and not the usual hotel hairdryers.
Wi-Fi with excellent signal in every area
Staff really friendly and helpful
Highly recommended!

title: Just outstanding! Prime location! A team that goes above and beyond!
text: Definelty a must stay! Excellent team, Tajmaly, Jose, Dino, Eartskin, Shaeena {Kipsu attendant}, the entire bar tending staff! Everyone I encountered was awesome. The doormen welcomed you at the entrance, Tajmaly really took care of us our entire stay! Everyone made you feel welcomed! I did not want to look strange asking people for their names! But even the handsome security guards that appeared so professional were guest driven!  Prime Location!- Right across from the Time Square Steps- Live Entertainment- Hershey Store- M & M Store, Krispy Kreme Flagship!  Beautiful property! Very upscale, tech savvy and modern. Super clean. State of the art gym. The restaurant/ bar was upscale with great prices, live music! The full band with a wonderful singer kept us entertained! - Sidenote, my niece left her iPad in the bed, the Lost and Found team lead by Jose, who took sole ownership of returning it in the fastest way- high regard of a keen sense of urgency! Just honesty and efficiency with a well-rounded team! Valet Parking available.

title: Best Hotel in Times Square NY
text:
Gorgeous hotel with a comfy bed, beautiful shower (Mirror has Bluetooth feature which is a plus) great view from 42nd floor. Recommend using the Hilton app for fast response from staff and special requests. 

Greeted at the door by security when entering and leaving to tour the city. We felt safe knowing staff was alert and observing all movement. Yassin was exceptionally attentive during every interaction. Thank you again!

title: Great staff, modern rooms, some issues
text:
Hotel is convenient location. Rooms are clean and modern. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Especially a gentlemen by the name of Yassin.  We did run into two problems in the room we reserved which was two queens so they gave us a king with a view but it was a smaller room.  And although we complained of a drape not working in the room, it was never repaired which made for some very 
bright nights and made it harder to sleep.  We’d stay again if we knew that wouldn’t a problem.  I mentioned it at check out and wasn’t offered any compensation

title: Convenient, but that's it
text: If you're just looking for a place with a bed and a shower near Times Square but with reasonable acoustic isolation, this might be the place for you. Also if you like whizzy hi-tech: the elevator system is impressive, and you get effective aircon, a Nespresso machine, and an oversized TV. But if you want normal hotel facilities, avoid. At check-in, the small reception area was chaotic, and a request for rooms near each other - made 3 months earlier and acknowledged - was not met. My room had no drawers or cupboards,  so apparently they expect guests to live out of a suitcase.  We walked out of the breakfast room as the breakfast offering was one of the worst I've ever come across. There's nothing in the bathroom except soap squeeze bottles - not even a paper cup. Everything is run by electronics, so don't bother looking for light switches.  You get the feeling you're in the hotel equivalent of an automated airport check-in with about as much character. Actually, the lobby differs from an airport in one respect: airports provide seating, but this hotel has virtually none. I've stayed in a 4-star Hilton near Times Square in the past, but the only 4-star aspect of this new Hilton is the price.

title: Great place to stay in Times Square
text: Great accommodations with all the perks expected from a Hilton family hotel. All the hotel staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful. 17th floor was very quiet for being in the middle of manhattan. My only complaint is that this review has to be at least 200 characters when 150 would suffice.

title: Excellent service from Yassin
text: Great service from Yassin, excellent employee and always checked on us to make sure our stay was great, will be returning. Nice hotel and great location within walking distance to a lot of restaurants and different activities. Enjoyed our stay

title: The oasis of relaxation immersed in the chaos of Times Square
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a week for my first visit to New York and I was really fully satisfied.
The location is unique, it is literally located in front of the Broadway steps in Times Square and from the rooms it is possible to admire all the screens and all the vitality of the beating heart of Manhattan. The entrance has a constantly manned concierge from which, with very comfortable elevators (never and I mean never late - also because there are 7 different ones to reach the floors without having to queue) you reach the hall with the reception. Here there is the restaurant and the lounge bar as well as a small shop where you can stock up on supplies for the minibar. From here you take the lift and reach the rooms. Every time an employee is present to provide assistance when calling the lifts, this demonstrates a truly appreciable attention to the customer's well-being. The rooms are large and spacious, fully soundproofed, with modern, quality furnishings. The tidy bathroom, equipped with Bluetooth mirrors to which you can connect your smartphone. Excellent cleaning with change of towels every day and great professionalism from the staff in charge. Highly recommended!

title: Comfy rooms and wonderful service. Too dependent on electronics!
text: Rooms very clean and beds very comfy - but no instructions on anything unless via an App and of course the internet.  Towels hardly used were  washed every day. It really necessary. Fabulous  staff all round: at Reception, at main entrance, and in the Highball restaurant. The food there was really good. Good size  but not excessive portions. Staff worked hard to get things as we wanted. Amin was a bit of a star, but so too were his colleagues!  Would recommend this hotel….

title: Perfect Stay!
text: Perfect location and the staff was great.  They always remembered us and greeted us all with a smile.  Security was even fabulous!  Thank you Yassin!! We definitely recommend Tempo for a great stay, attentive staff in a lively location. We will be back!

title: Trip to New York
text:
Stayed here with family for 7 nights. 
Location: cannot fault the location. Amazing spot local to the huddle and bustle. 

Hotel decor:  lovely modern decor. Room wasn’t very big but I suppose it’s the norm for a city hotel.  
Rooms: Blinds did not work in the room which was frustrating. 
Coffee pods not refilled all week. 
The room bins were emptied daily and towels changed.
Room not swept in 7 days.  
Bedding not changed  7 in days
No water bottles in the room
No slippers in the room

Reception: 
staff were very nice however we had a packed week and didn’t really speak to them. 
Door staff were very personable and friendly esp Hassain. 

The restaurant is pricey. 

We were surprised at the daily GC amount which was nearly $40 per room per night.

title: Perfect !
text: Absolutely loved this hotel, special birthday trip with my Mum. Hotel is clean, modern, amazing location, right in the middle of it all. Perfect ! Staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. Would definitely visit again. Thank you :-) highball restaurant within the hotel fab too !

title: Not worth your $ go somewhere else!!
text:
We are checking out today and wanted to tell you the pros and cons of this hotel. We are in a top floor two bedroom corner sweet!

Pros: 
Location
Views

Cons:
Phones don’t work in the suite
Blinds don’t work (we’ve had to call to have maintenance come in daily to allow the curtains to close)
No microwave in suite
No coffee in unit - they have a gross espresso 
Construction starts before 730a somewhere near our room. Lots of noise!!
Sprinkler covers have fallen several times one hit me! 
Asked for a blanket they brought us a sheet 
Screaming kids nearby our room went on for hours 
We had to have maintenance in our room every single day to fix something and they still couldn’t fix the phones or window coverings
The temp in the room if you set to say 70, at 69 the ac comes in till it’s about 63 then the heat kicks on till about 75 good luck being comfortable! 

Hotel didn’t offer us one thing - not even a free drink for our issues! Talk about high cost low customer service and maintaining their rooms!

Far cry from luxurious even paying $$$$!!

title: Gorgeous !
text:
Magnificent hotel, very beautiful room with exceptional bedding! Spacious, comfortable and modern bathroom. Bay window in the bedroom with breathtaking views of Times Square! Housekeeping done every day, Nespresso coffee machine with 3 pods/day, small fridge, safe.
Top hotel bar and restaurant
I recommend 300%
Many elevators with a very good system to avoid waiting.
Thank you for this wonderful week in New York

title: Great location and friendly service
text:
We got a really good deal for this hotel as it had just opened.  Trip was on Oct 8 2023 with my family of teenagers. The room was sufficient but tight, had 2 queen beds and a spacious bathroom.
The reception area is above building so you take the elevators up to check in.  It is a spacious area where guests mingled, the bar was also on the same floor as reception so it was busy.  The view from the check in area was great, looking down to the street.  Unfortunately when we arrived, there were scaffolding and still some construction being done on the building.
All the staff were just so friendly, including the doors people who greet you as you go up or come out of the elevators.  
I loved that it was just across the Hershey's Store (so did my girls) and it's steps away from the heart of NYC.  We walked everywhere from the hotel, lots of restaurants, stores and shows around.

title: Above & Beyond Property & Guest Service.
text:
We came in for a short visit to do shows and dining. I hadn’t previously heard of Tempo, as it is only 6 months old,  but it looked intriguing on the website. It did not disappoint! I love everything about it. From the moment we checked in with Taj at the front desk, who was very accommodating, through the moment we left,  was a great experience. Taj was more than helpful, and sincerely engaging. She even got us into it room early, which we appreciated after a long journey in. 

The staff is super friendly and helpful, especially Yassin! Every time we saw him, he had the most infectious smile and spirit. I wanted to scoop him up and take him with me. 

The whole experience was such a delight. Special nod to Taj at the front desk in Yassin, who are such an asset to tempo! 

We will be back!

title: Love this new hotel
text:
This new hotel is in a great location!  Clean, staff is very friendly, bar is great. We loved our overnight at Tempo.  All the team members were very helpful
From checking in, storing luggage etc. I felt very safe. Front doorman Yasmin was super friendly!

title: Excellent Staff
text:
The service support staff was wonderful particularly Amin. Staff were always eager to go above the call of duty and requests. 
The Hilton could hire additional staff to answer phones and service customers from the hours of 8-1am. Otherwise, Hilton is still #1!

title: Favorite Hilton property in the city
text: Everything at this hotel was truly incredible. The staff was so kind + helpful, loved the bar/restaurant in the lobby, BEAUTIFUL room and bathroom, great view and perfect location for those that want to be in Times Square/Midtown! I’ve stayed at a lot of Hilton hotels in nyc and this is by far my favorite going forward!

title: Très bien mais…
text: Nous sommes actuellement au Tempo sur Times square et je vous donne déjà mes premières impressions. Personnel très sympathique et souriant. L'hôtel est très beau très moderne. Rien à dire sur la propreté de la chambre top, salle de bains superbe, miroir Bluetooth . Seul petit bémol pas beaucoup de rangements dans la chambre. Vue sur Times Square  on ne peut mieux le hic c’est que cela s’entend….en effet un peu trop bruyant pour nous malgré les 23 étages…il y avait des étages beaucoup plus haut mais il fallait rajouter 100 $ par nuit soit 700 $ de plus donc non. Dommage je pense que cela aurait changer notre séjour….Je complèterai mon commentaire à la fin de notre séjour mais je tenais à donner mes impressions à chaud.’

title: Perfect for us including: location, cleanliness and kindness
text: Everything about this hotel was perfect for us!  The room had a greta view of Times Square steps from the 38th floor. We could see but not hear the noise! Also it was right around the corner from everything including the subway with Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, NYC Public Library and all the Broadway shows in walkable distance. The room had plenty of usb ports, a clean bathroom and bedroom and perfect beds and pillows. The evening elevator man was always friendly although all the staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  Loved the safety and quiet and respite despite being in the center of things.  We purchased some snacks and water from the market which was easy to use. We purchased early check in for an additional $75 but it was worth it for us so we didn't have to worry about anything. We loved the controls at both sides of the bed- so easy. Thank you for a great stay for my teen daughter and I.

title: Brilliant stay. Thank you
text: We’ve just returned home today. Fabulous hotel, staff were very helpful if we needed anything. There were petals under the chair that must have been from Valentine’s Day so I would say things need to be moved and cleaned underneath but overall this wasn’t an issue and would definitely stay again.

title: First trip to New York, Broadway shows
text: This was such a great hotel! The amenities were wonderful, rooms were clean and very modern, beds very comfy and the people were so friendly and helpful. The location was perfect to have access to any of the theaters, shops and food. Dino was especially wonderful. He gave wonderful food suggestions to us each day. Whether we were walking or taking the subway, he always made sure we were headed in the right direction. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone headed to the Times Square area of New York.

title: Stay at the Tempo by Hilton Times Square!
text: The hotel is in a stunning location with views of Times Square from your windows with easy access to everything! The decor and layout is lovely with great rooms that have everything you need. The bar/restaurant has beautiful views with great food and coffee too! The staff are fabulous, in particular Yassin who supports in reception and making sure you get the elevators to the right floor! He’s super friendly and bubbly, adding to a great experience in New York. A definite MUST stay!! This is a new hotel so the only feedback I would give is that sometimes the rooms could be cleaned to a slightly better standard but either way, it was a great stay!!!

title: Hotel  highly recommended
text: The hotel was very nice. The room had an excellent city view!  It was clean and quiet. Great location right in Times Square with easy access to the subway and lots of touristy stuff. The staff was friendly and super helpful especially Dino. He made our departure so easy by assisting us with our Uber.  Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Brilliant Hotel
text:
One of the nicest city hotels ive stayed it. 

Rooms were small but i expected that given the location. The rooms were very clean and looked after. Staff were friendly and lovely. 

Could have done with more coffee in the room but as soon as we started leaving more and more tips they added more pods! :) 

The hotel itself is literally in times square, you couldn't get any closer and so close to other places like the empire state building (20 min walk), central park, the theatres etc.

Despite being in a very busy area we were affected by any noise at all despite having a city view. 

Would absolutely recommend and would stay again!

title: The team at Tempo made our NYC stay even better!
text: We were welcomed by the nicest doormen and then gentlemen who checked us in (forgot his name but black guy with round framed glasses) was awesome! He was super friendly and made an early check in happened. We did have to wait for a little bit but we did have an early flight into the city so that was expected. We did some exploring and then hung out at Highball while our room was getting ready. Their team working the cafe were great and their coffee is even better! I wish I bought a bag! Everyone we encountered was so pleasant and greeted us so warmly. The room which I expected to be tiny was bigger than anticipated and the view was so awesome! We had a great little cut out where the chair sat and was a great overview of Times Square! It was my husband and son’s first trip to NYC and the team at Tempo made our trip the best! Thank you for amazing stay! I will be sure to tell everyone where to stay when wanting to visit NYC!

title: Great customer service.
text:
Everything and everyone was fantastic. 

Karina, Jen and Justin at the bar showed the best customer service. They worked well together. They went above and beyond for their customers. Very helpful. Answered everyone's questions. Just fantastic teamwork.

title: TV does not work. No water bottle in room.
text: The TV failed to get CNN or Fox News- just gave a spinning circle suggesting I try later. I tried many times. No water bottles in room, instead a cost saving "hydration center'" in lobby. I'm perfectly happy with faucet water but only small coffee cups. They only give 2 coffee capsules and one decaffeinated capsule. They try to force you to eat in their restaurant by giving a $35 credit. Good view as I was upgraded.

title: Style over substance, staff could learn to have better manners.
text:
Initial impression, lovely room, but they weren’t cleaned daily, only towels replaced and bin emptied. Used our $10 toon credit in the bar, staff insistent we take a seat, 2 beers and a 20% gratuity added to put 2 beers down, we did pay but feel it’s too much for 2 drinks put on a table.
Went for a drink another night, sat at the bar this time, served, then spent forever asking for the bill, whilst all the staff, spent there time chatting to a group of people at the bar. Was then charged for 4 drinks and had to correct them, they really did not want to bother with us. Eventually hill corrected.
On check out, asked about the bill ( we were in a rush to get car to airport) told don’t worry, all taken care of, assumed final bill would be emailed, still don’t know what they’ve taken from my card, tried live chat, said they couldn’t help and to call hotel, I asked for an email address or could they call on my behalf as very expensive from UK…chat was ended, tried again….chat was ended. It’s 2024, surely customers should be able to email a query?

title: Perfect one night stay
text: This hotel exceeded our expectations for a one night stay. This hotel is new, modern and chic. The front desk was courteous and friendly. Our room was on the 23rd floor. Although small, it had all the amenities we like at a hotel. The views of time square were great and the automatic lighting and shades were great. The room had a frig, Nespresso machine, a comfortable king bed, luggage space, and the bathroom was large with a great shower. We would absolutely recommend Tempo by Hilton to anyone looking for a place in NYC with a prime location central to Times Square!

title: A GEM in Times Square
text: Another great stay at the newly opened Tempo. Marta at the Front Desk was so amazing and welcoming upon my arrival and big thank you to Cary in the sales team for taking care of us. The rooms are beautiful and great views of the city and the midtown skyline. An excellent option for Times Square and Highball Restaurant offers a great selection of cocktails and food.

title: Best Customer Service
text: Absolutely loved this hotels hospitality and the view from the 23rd floor was amazing. The restaurant on the 11th floor served as a meeting place for business meetings and the servers were great. Also the greeter Yassin was always so helpful no matter what time the day or night.

title: Amazing staff
text: We had an amazing stay. The bar staff (Justin and Jennifer) were great- along with all their co-workers that night. Yassin helped us find great places to eat and even showed us how to get there. He was helpful and pleasant the whole trip. Great staff at this hotel!

title: Anniversary trip
text: Great  hotel and  very friendly staff.  Right in the middle of all the action of Times Square but still has a nice quite relaxing feel somehow.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The front door man Yassin was super friendly and gave us great tips on places to visit.  We will definitely be back soon .

title: Best hotel in time square .
text: I love this hotel , the design , the attention to detail for the guest and the staff are just amazing . The view of time square is unlike any other view I’ve had here in the city . Yassin and Tahj are the best . So professional , so friendly . Really made the trip so enjoyable.

title: This is the place to stay in Times Square
text: Alright, my friends! Buckle up because this place is freaking fantastic. It's exactly what you need for a business or family trip in the heart of the city.  For me it was a combined trip and we left quite happy.  I had read reviews about the staff going above and beyond.  It's smart. Set's the hotel apart.  Right away I experienced it on arrival. Everyone gives a #### about you.  Even the team at the door is welcoming and super helpful.  You ride the initial elevator up to the 11th floor and you'll be greeted by a great team.  Shoutout to Yassin.  I had read reviews about him being awesome- guess what? He is! I feel like I met a TripAdvisor super hero from all the positive reviews.  They are not lying, the guy is freaking awesome. Have an obscure question? (Like where to buy water bottles- you should get one, $10, it builds a well and there are fill-ups everywhere.) Yassin figured out who would know and have the bottles and made it happen.  Super positive energy. Really makes the place shine.  The rooms were great. Incredible showers.  Clean rooms.  It is expensive but worth the Hilton Points or dollars (or both!).  The restaurant/lounge is *stupid* expensive.  $19 avocado toast? hahahahahaha.  $40 for a cocktail and a soda? Yup. Welcome to the big time at the big city.  It also closes pretty early at night. So the restaurant isn't the place for all your eats but the location is absolutely the best spot in town.  This has become our new go-to for city trips, personal or business. Looking forward to my next trip just so I can stay here again.  My last impression? Damn these guys are good.  Shoutout to Dino out front.  When he heard we had an uber incoming on our departure- he went a several hundred yards down the street to let our uber know he could pull into the valet / hotel parking zone to pick us up.  This done in the pouring rain.  He certainly didn't need to do that.  But he did and loaded up our luggage.  What a cool guy!  Thank you Tempo! Can't wait to come back!

title: Fantastic stay in Times Square
text:
Stayed for 3 night at this lovely new tempo by Hilton! We were given room 3405 a king corner room on the 34th floor, what a view! Immaculate room, beautiful bathroom and very comfortable bed. Couldn’t fault the room at all. 

All staff were always friendly on entering the hotel daily and the reception staff / hosts. 

Hotel decor is beautiful and the hotel location is fantastic!

If we had to be critical, the only thing we would  mention is the breakfast / food facilities, very small selection of breakfast choices hence why we did not eat in the hotel. The happy hour is just 3 drinks out of a menu of around 200 drinks and finally the hotel reception area is really small so nowhere to sit and wait if waiting for a taxi for example. Sitting in the restaurant is not always possible as we are not always looking to drink so some seating would be ideal although not sure how or where as it’s a small area.

Overall a fabulous stay in a very modern clean and friendly new hotel.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Quero parabenizar a excelente estadia que tivemos no hotel . Ressalto a sensacional recepção e acolhimento da funcionária Kessi .
Estrutura e limpeza dos quartos excelentes . Com certeza indicaria para amigos . Localização maravilhosa…Parabéns !

title: Terribile experience behind any stretch of immigration 😡
text:
Really saddened me having to write a negative review; however in light of our terrible experience I hope this will help others who have a proper knowledge and understanding of the meaning of of the STARS. 
For clarity my husband and I are consistently travelling around the world for more than 30 years, and we stayed in some of the most luxurious hotels for example:
The Anantara Hotel Bangok, the Anantara horel Abusjabi the Rixos the Palm Dubai, etc… so when we give a review based on stars we perfectly know what are talking about… and what to expect about hotels and their staff and the service they offer.
On arrival we were given room 2618 and as we entered the electric blackout curtains where in all over the place and outside the railings so we couldn’t open or closed them properly. The fridge freezer empty and the ensuite and everywhere infact full of black airs. I managed to get hold of receptionist after 1 hour😡 and eventually someone was sent to fix the curtain…
Two half sparkling bottles of waters 21 dollars … mist have been mixed with gold
The mattress was sinking and we couldn’t sleep well
First night a disaster😡
The light breakfast is not at all included and infact it is rather shameful… the person at the till will show you food premade and ask you in s very intimidating  way to give a tip which 15% he told us be very poor… fir what really for bringing the food from the fridge to the counter 1 mt circa away. I did explain that in Europe we give tips if we feel that a good service has been delivered…. But he pushed us so badly and felt like if we where obliged to do it…. The bill was around 74 pounds for the ever worst breakfast consumed in our life🤮 that already ruined my first day
After few days We finished the shower gel and in the morning before going out we kindly asked at reception to refill and on our return a bottle was left on top of our hand luggage 🙈 
Outside the hotel there was an advertisement for Happy Hour… it turned out that there was a very limited selection of cocktails not particularly nice and also you pay for everything is not like in Europe where happy hour means that one over every 2 drinks is free. The waiter was giving tap water something I don’t ever drink and when we politely declined he pulled a disgusting face and seed so you are only going to drink alcohol 🙈 seriously I occasionally drink and do I need to justify myself… he was also constantly addressing us with Hi guys… really??? How disrespectful and clearly discriminatory when you are tolling to people that  are no longer that young … very unprofessional and unimpressive  considering we were customers and not his friends. This was generally  speaking the way we were addressed by the staff , behind unacceptable  for a 4 star hotel. On our check out I was asked how was our stay and I  genuinely  told terrible and requested to talk with a manager. I did explain how unsatisfied we were and that I wanted a full refund… he  as well started addressing me as you guys. I sdo told him that I wasn’t his friend and that it was not professional or  acceptable way to address customers older than him and mostly customer. title: Great concept, terrible exection
text:
I had a VERY unfortunate stay at Tempo by Hilton New York Times Square the past few days. There were multiple issues with the room and the service, and I ultimately was not provided with all the amenities I paid for. There were also underhanded sales tactics at the hotel restaurant/bar and issues picking up a package.

Initially, I checked in via the app. I had to try a few times to unlock the door. The room itsef had no issues, but the difficulty with opening the door persisted. We had to wait in line at the front desk the next day to to get physical cards, which then failed to open the door. I was told they would resolve this issue while I was out, but no action was taken. I inquired again upon returning to the hotel that day, after having to wait in line for almost 30 minutes, and the front desk staff ultimately had to give us a new room. I asked if this room would have the same amenities and was told yes.

The second room had no issues with the door, but several new issues. There was an unpleasant smell, which is likely why I found the window open upon arriving. The sink in the bathroom was backed up, and the toilet paper holder was hanging at an angle so that the roll kept falling off. I paid for a room with a Peloton, which the new room had, but someone had swapped the normal pedals out (which can be used with normal shoes), for pedals that required delta cleets. I went to front desk again, and waited again, asking for them to swap out the pedals and fix the other issues. Again, I was told they would fix it. When I returned, it seemed like the pedals had been swapped out, but the bathroom issues were not addressed. When I went to use the Peloton in the morning, though, I realized the pedal had been installed incorrectly, with the pedal and screw sticking out at angle and obvious metal shavings on the floor where the screw had been stripped by whoever installedd it.

I also sent a small package to the hotel for the day I checked in, and asked the front desk three times during these interactions before they were able to provide me with it on the third day (but the tracking information and the hotel staff confirmed it was delivered on the first day).

Worse, during the first interaction, the front desk staff convinced me that I had a $45/day credit for hotel bar and restaurant. They neglected to mention there was also a $35 resort fee, so that i was only getting a $10 credit. The underhanded sales tactics continued at the restaurant, where we requested tap water and were given a $12 bottle of still water by the server. We were also charged $33 for an appetizer, despite it being listed for $19, and had to request an itemized receipt and correction. They server also failed to tell us that there is auto-gratuity of 22% both when seating us or when we paid. We were only provided with the itemized receipt upon request, where we discovered that. The quality of the cocktails and food was also poor, although at least that's subjective.

Suffice it to say, I will not be staying at this hotel again. The concept seemed great, but the execution was terrible.

title: Nice addition, but do not deal with the front desk until after 3 pm.
text:
Do not check in early. Do not attempt to check in early Do not.  The A.M. front desk folks hate their jobs and anyone who attempts to check in. Wait until after 4 pm. Do yourself a favor. I'm in my 9.5 year as a Hilton Diamond member. I have been loyal to Hilton as I travel three weeks a month for work (and even own a timeshare in mid-town Manhattan) and yet to check in early at noon instead of 3 pm was a $150 dollar upcharge for guests or $75 for Diamond members. I said no. Normally, a hotel will welcome guests in if there's a room available - it's called hospitality and reduces the number of check-ins later. The morning front desk needs to learn this. It literally costs nothing to check someone in early yet garners good will. If there are no rooms available because they're still being cleaned cool. That was not the case here. So...don't do it. The afternoon desk agents could not have been nicer. They get what hospitality is about. They were kind, considerate, welcoming. 

This is a rebuild of the old doubletree that sat at this spot for years. This a a beautiful redo. Rooms are on the small side, but not as small as the Motto brand which are half this size. Great amenities, comfortable beds. The bar was lovely and bartenders great. The bell staff at the front door were so nice. 

The rooms are wonderful, but you get what you reserve, so choose wisely. Rain shower, a bluetooth speaker in the mirror in the bathroom with clock and nightlight sensor were my highlights. But, it's in Times Square so bright day and night. There are black out curtains on the main switch at the front door of your room which can also control all the lights. 

Will stay again. But will check in after 4 pm every single time.

text:

title: Very shinny at first, but a let down in too many respects
text:
11 -17 Jan 2024.  This hotel is located in the middle of Times Square and in easy reach of many subway stations.  On arrival we were asked if we would like to upgrade at 40 USD per night as we had booked a room that was on a lower level and maybe noise.  I took the opinion to upgrade and was given a room on the 44th floor.  The rooms are decorated to a good standard and modern in design.  The view was excellent although this was night time.  Curtains and lighting are controlled by switches on either side of the bed sadly the controls on one side were not working at all, reported to reception who invited us to move rooms as we had yet to unpack it wasn’t much of an ordeal but did delay us from going out to dinner by an hour.  Our second room was 3902 located on the 39th floor, I was told this was a double upgrade but no further charge would be made ( this room would apparently cost 90 USD per day to upgrade) 
This had a double aspect view looking downtown, you could still hear street noise which was constant.  On the second evening i could dripping water behind one of the curtains, water was dripping down from what appeared to be a structural crack in the window frame, it had not been raining during out time in NY.  I reported this to the male receptionist who seemed uninterested and said we couple move again, we were about to leave for our broadway show and asked for the water to be clean up and investigated.  I also pointed out that this was not a new problem as when i was looking for the source of the water i noted several water stains on the fabric of the curtainn and valance.  When i remarked on this to the receptionist he said we are a new hotel and have teething problems, I reply its a bit crap as this was our second room and the problems would be obvious to house keeping staff, the receptionist asked me to stop using the profound language (Crap) I think some conflict resolution training is needed.
We came vback and the water had been mopped but nothing else.  During the early hours of the next morning I was woken by dripping water again!!  At this point I gave up and concentrated on my vacation as it was obvious the staff at this hotel lacked customer satisfaction.
That said the hotel did have its good points the bed was comfortable and the towels and linens are good quality.  The coffee machine is a waste of time it’s a small espresso type with tiny paper cups provided.  We used the bar once which was ok but again I think the staff could be more attentive 
The guy looking after the luggage was really friendly and polite
Would I recommend this place then sadly NO, it does has a lot going for it but too many negatives for me.

title: Disaster front desk representative
text:
I give one star to the Tempo Hilton Hotel. I tried to open my room at around 6:50 on 01/05/24 in the morning with the digital key, but it was not working for the gym. When I tried to get my physical card from the room, it also didn’t work and prompted me to call.

I called five times with no answer, so I went down to reception. There, I encountered the rudest receptionist I’ve ever met. He said that security had to go up with me to check my ID, even though my digital key and ID were not accepted as proof.

While I understand and appreciate good safety measures, I complained about the digital key not working and the inconvenience caused. Instead of acknowledging my frustration, the receptionist told me not to raise my voice and accused me of being disrespectful. He claimed that I had been discussing for 10 minutes, which was not the case; I was not even at the reception for 10 minutes.

The receptionist then called his manager. The manager was very nice, wanting to understand the situation. However, the receptionist interrupted me while I was explaining to the manager. I had to remind him that he called his manager because he did not want to speak to me, and the discussion was now between me and the manager, not between me and him.

The manager acknowledged the issue and apologized, assuring me they would work on it, something the receptionist failed to do. Throughout, the receptionist kept insisting he was right, blaming me for the errors. He desperately needs basic communication training or perhaps a different role not in customer service of a $200-plus per night hotel.

His attitude has unfortunately cast a shadow over my entire stay at the hotel. I will choose a different hotel next time, as New York has plenty of options. I no longer feel comfortable at this hotel.

If you want good service, I would recommend different options, not this hotel.

I suggest the manager review the CCTV, as I never raised my voice, discussed for 10 minutes, or did any of the other unfriendly things he accused me of.

title: Dishonest hotel won’t accept accountability ….stay away
text:
2 days before we were due to fly to New York I  noticed a pending charge on my card for £528.74, puzzled,  thought  my option is to pay in full on arrival.    After our plane was delayed for 4 hours from Dublin we arrived at Tempo NY Hilton Times Square at 11pm on 23rd Dec shattered, stressed, tired and disappointed we missed out  on the daytime sight seeing because we should have arrived in the afternoon.

title: Theater trip to New York
text:
I stayed at the Tempo by Hilton for five nights in October, during their soft opening, right before their actual opening. There was some construction outside still taking place the week before opening that made the entrance a little bit challenging to find. Fortunately, they had staff positioned at every potential point where a guest may have had a question.

I arrived a little earlier, prior to check in time and they were able to get me into a room. I was glad that I could leave my bags in my room and start my New York adventure.

The room is a little compact but it was fine because it was just me in the room. There is no closet, but rather a rack with hangers where you can hang stuff up, above where you can set your luggage on a ledge.

I loved the Bluetooth mirror in the bathroom, which was easy to pair with my phone. I also love Apotheke products, which was the brand of the bathroom soaps and shampoos.

When you enter the hotel from the street, you take an elevator up to the lobby. To get to your room, you transfer to another set of elevators. The elevator system is very efficient because it's the type where you enter the floor you need and it tells you which elevator to get into and it goes directly to that floor (and any other floors of the people who are in the elevator with you). The lobby could be a bit more organized, though. I didn't like how when I was waiting to speak to someone at one of the desk pods, people would cut in front of me. It happened more than once.

The restaurant in the lobby was convenient to pick up morning coffee and pastries. My friends and I brought pizza back one evening and they wouldn't let us sit in the cafe area. We made it clear that we wanted to order drinks but they wouldn't let us in, so we sat in the lobby instead, taking up what little seating there is in the lobby. The cafe closed shortly after we sat down so we felt it was silly that we couldn't sit there and also order drinks.

On Saturday night we wanted to get drinks at the bar but they wouldn't let us in because they were closing for construction. It was 10pm. This feels like a missed opportunity because 10pm on Saturday night is prime drinking time and they were closing for the night. Hopefully they finished all of the construction in time for opening.

text: Very nice, modern hotel, located right in the heart of Times Square, on 47th and Broadway. Location is perfect, close to major attractions that are all within walking distance. It's already costly to stay at this hotel and this extra charge is just a cash grab, especially when the charge includes premium high speed wifi which is not premium at all! title: Avoid this place.
text:
I am currently at this hotel and while it's rare for me to do review before leaving the location,  I think it's only fair to warn off as many people as possible from making the same mistakes as I have. 

We arrived to Tempo on Saturday 16th December around 3:30pm.  We were told our rooms are not ready yet and to take a seat in the restaurant.  We waited around 45 minutes whilst the rooms were cleaned,  checked and made available..... which is not the end of the world.  But after travelling all the way from London we were ready for a rest. 

And this is where the problems began.  The hotel WiFi was not working (and still not when I write this)  The hotel staff didn't seem bothered by this and couldn't understand why I was making a fuss or refusing to pay for the internet charge.  Considering it's a city centre hotel WiFi is important to business customers and families alike,  but no one cared.  Then theres the rooms itself.  Ignoring the fact that I'm paying almost $18,000  for our stay,  there's no water in the rooms,  no facility to make tea and only paper cups.  Our room was not cleaned for 3 days,  until my wife called reception to ask why, and they struggle to answer the phone at reception at the best of times. The rooms are compact,  theres almost no. storage space other than a clothes rail and coat hooks on the wall. It's not ideal when you're staying for 12 days with 5 or 6 cases in an expensive but small room. I get they are trying to be "eco friendly" and reduce plastic waste,  but there's no reason why water cannot be provided in recycled plastic or even glass bottles. 

And then there's the restaurant!!  It would be an insult the give this any sort of star rating.  The food is expensive,  the choices are very limited and having to eat breakfast out of a cardboard box with a plastic fork is not an experience I enjoy or recommend.  The one saving grace is Chef Kitt who has gone out of his way to help us with my sons food as he has some severe allergies.  Other than that,  I recommend you go out somewhere else for all meals. 

Oh... band don't get me started on the in hotel shop.  Once you see that  1ltr bottle of water costs $12 you won't be going back there for anything else. 

So I advice you look for somewhere better and cheaper to stay. If I could afford to move to another hotel at this late stage I would have gone already.

title: Cozy Rooms with a View
text:
My husband and I stayed at Tempo for our anniversary. We stayed for 4-nights. 

Location: The area around Tempo was very busy, but expected considering it is in the heart of Times Square at the corner of 47th and Broadway. You are within a 5-10 minute walk from various restaurants, the Rockefeller center, Minskoff theatre, and Radio City. 

Check-In: We decided to do early check-in for an additional $75. There is a daily fee charged of $35 that will be added to your bill when you check out. We did have issues with our room key on arrival and had to come back for a new key later in the day when the key machine was working. 

Staff & Food: The staff were all friendly. There is a restaurant and bar located on the 11th floor where the lobby is as well. They have live music on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights, which we did enjoy. 

The Room: Small but cozy with a beautiful view of the city from the 40th floor. Our drapes were likely off track or had some kind of issue as they did not always open and close appropriately. Each room has a fridge and safe, no microwave. Rooms were cleaned daily and well kept.

Check-Out: Check-out is at noon, you can do a late check-out but will get charged for half a day. They have a chauffeur service available for transport to the airport/next location if needed and they always have car service on standby.

title: Egregious lack of soundproofing in certain rooms
text:
This was going to be an enthusiastic 5 star review until an egregiously unacceptable oversight in soundproofing made our stay incredibly uncomfortable.

I’m not certain how other rooms are separated, but our room had a door that opened to a wall. We quickly realized that this very thin wall had to be the other side of the next door room’s bathroom wall. With zero soundproofing. Actually, worse than zero soundproofing, the (lack of) construction AMPLIFIED every. single. noise. the neighbors made in the bathroom. Loudly. 

Conversations, going to the bathroom, and… shower sex sessions that was like graphic porn was being directly amplified into our hotel room. Good for them, get that fun hotel sex. However, when you can hear every graphic, fluid detail (I am not talking about muffled moans, I am saying I unwillingly knew exactly what was happening every moment of their session) of strangers next door having sex basically like it was done in front of a megaphone directly into our room, it took away from feeling like we had our own private space to relax after our city exploring. And, on the flip side, we didn’t want to disturb them as well, so we were making sure we were speaking softly & being more quiet than natural. Yes, we turned up the tv and tried to tune out the noise, but the way that space between rooms was designed, it was echoing and bouncing off the walls like freaking surround sound.

Yes, the location is great, the room itself was well designed for our needs, loved the bathroom & bed, the staff was kind and efficient. But the soundproofing design flaw really took away our ability to feel like we could decompress and relax in our own private space.

title: Amazing
text: I loved the experience I had with Tempo by Hilton, Its a perfect spot to stay just above Time Square. Every spot is just closest to this hotel. The Service was super fine. The food was amazing. Especially Amin from F&B is just the sweetest, and I really appreciate his service. Definitely looking forward to visit again

title: Great customer service

title: Another great stay

Compared to my 1st stay, which was just weeks after they’d opened the door, this was a completely different experience, the team are much tighter, the kinks in the buildings new interiors have been worked out and overall, the first stay was great, this one was amazing! 

Shout out to front desk and the lovely team that make you feel so welcome, and to Amin in the breakfast team who just goes that extra mile to make the start of your day great.

title: Very friendly attentive best bartender

Just for him. He attended to us all night, we were never left without a drink , and to top it off the drinks he made were seriously wonderful!  My fiancé and I are from are LA and Justin made some of the best drinks we’ve ever had.

title: Great visit to NYC!

Justin in the sky lab bar was fun, friendly and made the best drinks ever! He should get a raise!!

title: A Hotel That Goes Above and Beyond the Call
text: We chose Tempo by Hilton because we'd read the great reviews about the staff.  It turns out the reviews were wrong: They UNDERstated how phenomenal the service is. Throughout our stay EVERYONE was very upbeat and went out of their way to be helpful. But all of that pales to what happened after we checked out. We had just called an Uber when my wife got suddenly and violently ill with what turned out to the the flu. Without getting too graphic, she started vomiting and then passed out. The staff came running out to help, bringing a wheelchair, towels to clear her up, calling the hotel doctor, and taking her back into the hotel. They put us back in the room we'd  been staying, told us they'd charge us less than half their lowest rate. From then until we left, every time I went to the lobby the staff asked me how she was doing,. The manager called our room to check on her. When I went to the hotel restaurant to see if they had any watermelon - the only thing that sounded good to her - the chef personally made a beautiful, huge platter of watermelon and refused to let me pay for it. In short, I've never seen a hotel go above and beyond the call like at. (Oh, BTW, the hotel is very stylish yet comfortable, and shockingly quiet given its Times Square location.) In short, I can't recommend the Tempo by Hilton New York Times Square more highly.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
I want to start my email by telling you how wonderful Jose the bellman is at this hotel. He should be recognized as one of your most valuable assets. 
I chose to stay at this new hotel because this is where my wife and I had stayed there when it was a doubletree several years ago. After the doubletree closed we chose to stay at the Hilton on the Avenue of the Americas. Mistake number one on this trip was not going back to the Hilton.
We arrived in the city around 10:30am on Tuesday November 7th. I went to the front desk to try and check in. Much to our surprise there was a room ready. An even bigger surprise was when I was charged $150.00 to check in early. I guess I am wrong to assume that as a Diamond member who has spent over 100 nights in your hotels in 2023 that an early check in was a benefit I had earned. After talking with the front office manager later that night she was able to remove this charge from the final bill.
After spending the day walking around and enjoying New York City we stopped at the chick-fil-a to get my 7 year old son some chicken nuggets. My wife and I were going to use the close to $50.00 F&B credit in the hotel restaurant to have dinner. I was again surprised when the waitress came over and informed us that we could not have outside food in the restaurant while the kitchen was open. I could understand this if the restaurant had a kids menu but it does not. So on day one I was unable to use my F&B credit.
After walking back to chick-fil-a to get myself and my wife dinner to eat with our son I went back to the lobby to ask to speak to a manager. It was 5:30pm. Anyone that could actually do something had already left for the day. It is my understanding after speaking with Destiny who I believe was the front office manager that Matt is the GM of this property. I asked her to have Matt call me. She assured me that everything we spoke about would be put in her report and Matt would give me a call. 3 days later and Matt still has not given me a call.
This hotel has a "market" area as well as a restaurant. The restaurant is open for breakfast for a few hours in the morning. Beside the counter they have a cooler where you can get drinks and snacks. If you get something from here you can use it as part of the F&B credit. However this cooler closes at 11am so when you come back in the afternoon and want a soft drink or a bottle of water you have to get it from the "market" area. The food and beverage you get from the "market" area is not allowed to be charged as F&B. Can someone please explain this one to me?
Thursday when it was time for us to leave we went back to the hotel to get our bags. We were going to use the restroom in the lobby area before we got in our uber to head to the airport. We were once again hit with a surprise. The not so wonderful restaurant where you can not get a decent meal and especially can not get anything for a kid to eat was closed for a private event. Guess where the restroom is. You got it. The closed restaurant. So I guess we will just hold it for the hour ride to LGA. Speaking of restaurants you should change the about us section of this hotel on their website and the app. You claim that the restaurant has iconic NYC views. It has a great view of a solid dark wall. Maybe it should read if you walk out of the restaurant and down the hall pass the check in counter then you can have an iconic view.
Just an overall bad experience. I expected more from a brand new hotel in times square. I expected the same level of service and hospitality that I receive at countless other hilton hotels around the country. Go back to being a doubletree. Or better yet in my case I will stay where I know the service and food is good. The hilton around the corner.

Bianca is hilarious. The room was perfect. The bed was sooo comfortable and the auto shades allowed us to get quality sleep with the all of the lights of Time Square outside. text: My colleagues and I stayed here for two nights during a work trip, and it was amazing. Whoever designed the hotel and the layout of the room really thought of everything.
