title: Bravo Tempo - just start serving tea and you'll be perfect!
text: The beds are to die for!!!  We have stayed in this hotel before it shut down when it was the Double Trees Suites and we've stayed there twice originally.  It is now Tempo Suites and it is amazing.  Still ironing out some issues looking at the reviews but our experience was overall great.  We are regular visitors to New York and we will stay again.  We had a little trouble checking with our room key with the key not working, (wrong room keyed in at front desk), given another room which was wrong again, got in this time to find a bouquet of flowers for someone else and then upgraded to a top floor with a ball drop view room (thank you very much!).  We didn't mind! The first room was great anyway but the second room was jaw dropping!  Ironically we had stayed in that style of room before and it was interested to see the differences with the refurb.  The room was perfectly thought out with shades which are electronic.  Coffee machine but only three pods so you have to fight if there are 2 of you but no problem you can buy a pack in the shop downstairs.  The beds are amazing!  As comfortable as the ones in the Bellagio in Las Vegas and no bed has EVER come close to that in my eyes over 10 years ago!  Like you are sleeping on a cloud if you can imagine that (if I can imagine that!).  Things to improve: 1) please serve tea to the Brits at the very least.  I was dying for a cup and they refused to serve me a cup "oh no we don't serve that here".  Really?!  What happened to the American dream of you can have anything you wan?!  Apart from a cup of tea?!  2)  Highball restaurant which by the way is going to have a fab outdoor dining terrace due to be complete by end of Nov is FREEZING!!!  Everyone sat in coats.  I asked why so cold the staff knew about this but appeared to not have any answers as to why so why Tempo is it sooooooo cold?  Made me very reluctant to want to be there but maybe that's why to discourage you to stay too long?  The food is amazing though but prepare to be very cold. Overall though this is still a 5 star experience and we will be back!  Thanks Tempo - great job x

title: An modern oasis overlooking Times Square!
text: An oasis overlooking Times Square! Rooms are beautiful, modern, clean and surprisingly quiet given the location. A great value overall, and the staff was super nice too. A special shout out to our bellman extraordinaire Van, who let us use his personal umbrella on a rainy Sunday.

title: Poor level of service
text:
I am writing to express my extreme disappointment with the service we received during our recent stay at your hotel. Unfortunately, our experience was marred by several significant issues that I feel compelled to bring to your attention.

Firstly, upon our arrival, we encountered a security issue where we were robbed by a scamming cab driver who charged our credit card a staggering amount of 650 USD from JFK. Understandably, we immediately sought assistance from your security team to obtain video footage of the incident. However, despite our repeated requests, we were left waiting for an extended period of time without any response or assistance. It took us two days to finally meet with the head of security, which is simply unacceptable.

Furthermore, we were also disappointed with the housekeeping service. On the fourth day of our stay, our room was not serviced despite our request to the reception before leaving for dinner. Upon our return, we were dismayed to find that the room had not been attended to.

Additionally, during our entire stay, we found the overall level of service to be poor. The reception area was cramped with limited seating, making it difficult for guests to comfortably wait. Moreover, the lack of storage space in our room was inconvenient, especially during a six-day stay. The rooms were also noisy, further adding to our disappointment.

To make matters worse, when we checked out, we were informed that the system was down and we could not receive a receipt. This lack of organization and communication only added to our frustration.

As loyal of Hilton hotels, we had high expectations for our stay at your establishment. However, the service we received fell far short of these expectations. It is disheartening to compare our experience with the neighboring hotel, where the hospitality and security were significantly better.

Regrettably, based on our experience, we have no intention of returning to your hotel in the future. We hope that you take our feedback seriously and make the necessary improvements to ensure a more satisfactory experience for your guests.

title: Really good in every way!
text: This hotel is even nicer in person than it looks in photos. Great location leas than a 30 second walk from Times Square. Our room was super clean with high end furnishings, and an excellent bed. They had a ton of very friendly staff that was always around to welcome you, hold doors, direct you to your elevator (which you never have to wait for), etc. We usually like to venture out for meals but the breakfast food was so good that we didn’t go anywhere else. The oatmeal is as good as I’ve had anywhere and the breakfast bowl was equally good. Both were full of fresh, hardy ingredients. Again, tons of friendly service. Henry went out of his way to get the chef to make some breakfast items for us when we overslept after a red eye and the kitchen had already switched over to lunch. We loved everything about our stay. Highly recommend.

title: Useless hipsters and security personnel that go through your safe.
text:
The hipsters at the front desk are completely useless. I came in late on a Thursday night, my airline had lost my bag and I didn't have anything with me. I asked the front desk where I could buy a toothbrush and toothpaste and they told me that they would send it to my room. I was really happy about it as I was exhausted after the travel. But they never sent it. I called the front desk much later and politely asked if I could pick it up. No need Sir! We will send it up right away! Nope, it never arrived. 

The morning after I was looking forward to having coffee in my room, and I had a great Nespresso. Nope, it was broken. Back to front and ask them to change it. No problem Sir! We will do it right away. I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and asked them to change it every day. On the 5th day, it was finally changed.

Then for the most serious part. On my second day, I came back to my room at about 1 p.m., and as I walked to my room two security guards from the hotel were walking out of life my room, holding everything I had locked in the safe! My computer, my passport, my wallet, everything!!! The excuse was that there was luggage in the room I must have checked out! I didn't receive any email or phone call from the hotel to confirm it, they just took it!

Other than that the room was nice and it was cleaned really well every day. The staff, other than the useless hipsters at the front desk and the two security guards were all good and made me feel welcome.

title: Great in every way. Perfect location
text:
The facility and staff exceeded expectations. Room clean and very comfortable. Beds 10/10, great shower, partial view of Times Square from the 44th floor. The LOCATION is perfect! Easy access to everything. 
We were particularly impressed by Harun who mage us feel welcome and was very helpful. Also, Nru in the bar/cafe. Very professional and attentive. And the porters went above and beyond - Kingston was great. 
Will definitely book again when I am next in NYC.
Good value for the money.

title: Wonderful dinner
text: The restaurant went above and beyond all expectations! Nur our server for dinner in the hotel was very attentive and even gave me a birthday dessert since I was celebrating my 21st birthday! 10/10 would recommend.

title: Nice hotel with minor glitches
text:
Hotel was very clean. Floor to ceiling windows with motorizes drape and sheer. Bed and pillows very comfortable. King room can feel cramped, especially between the desk and the wall. Liked the “night light mirror “ in the bathroom.
Lobby is small for a hotel that accepts group tours. Room on 43 floor very quiet. HVAC operates well and is unobtrusive .
Tip: Boomers will need reading  glasses for the small print on the small buttons.
Tip: Make sure to ask about the discounts that come with the mandatory urban destination fee. That was not offered when we received the room key.
Tip: If you get food or beverage from the gift shop it is not included in the $10 allowance. You must get from the restaurant.
Tip: If you want to use your allowance in a soda for example, do before the restaurant opens for diner. Once dinner starts they close the shelf and you have to pay for the same at the gift shop (Sneaky)

title: Great experience
text:
Great hotel and great staff, Kessi was very friendly and patient with us as she helped us book our bus tour, she explained everything clearly and answered all of our questions. 

The only annoying part of my stay was trying to figure out how to connect to the wifi. You still get free wifi thought so it’s all good

title: Plentiful Elevators, good staff, clean hotel, overall good location
text: We arrived on Friday, October 20, after waking up at 3:30 am our time. We knew our room might not be ready, but unfortunately the hotel's whole system wasn't working. So we were offered luggage storage and told we would be called when our room was ready. We ate breakfast, wandered around Rockefeller Plaza and never heard back. So we went back around 2:45 pm to a huge line. I tried to check in online at that point and was unable. So waited in the line only to be told our room was ready. While I understand this was unusual, I was disappointed that we were never contacted. The elevators are plentiful and fast, which was great. The room was tight for 4 with luggage, but doable. The blinds are electronic, but ours was already broken and on our last night we couldn't get the blinds down, only the shears so our room was quite bright. Definitely working out the kinks, but overall a great location and great hotel. I tried to call the hotel to provide feedback, but was told to post it here. I was hoping to get our rate adjusted at check in as I found a slightly cheaper rate, but with the enormous line I didn't both and then was unable to get it fixed during our stay. Also we did call down for pillows and extra towels and only after calling back were they delivered. I'd definitely recommend the hotel, but like I said, a few kinks still to be worked out.

title: A GEM in Times Square
text: Lovely new hotel in the middle of lively Times Square and the theater district. Their restaurant and bar provides beautiful views of the city and the rooms are very spacious for Manhattan and brand new! BIG THANK YOU to Charlene at the front desk for getting me checked in quickly and being so welcoming. Looking forward to returning soon.

title: It's the little things
text:
Upon our arrival on the afternoon of 10/20 we exited the lobby elevator to a roped off sea of suitcases, some people in line (like 4 or 5), and no clear idea what was going on. Finally find out the system is down. I understand its a new hotel but I didn't really get a great answer just come back at 4. Ok so where do I check my bags? "over there".  A not so pleasant gentlemen took my bags and we set out to explore until 4 :30 sh. Of course it poured while we were out, so when we returned soaking wet to the hotel after 4pm there was a line of people all the way back to the restaurant/lounge. So I waited while my husband who had hurt his foot while we were out sat in the lounge area. When I finally got to the desk, I handed the gentleman my credit card and DL explained the room was in my husbands name but he was in the lounge and I had no signal and couldn't get on the wifi to reach him. I was given two keys for us, no other explanation about anything whatsoever, got my bags and we went to change into dry clothes. 

The room was on a high floor, small and clean. Nice to have many plugs and a window to pop open. The bed and pillows were comfy, and the bath was nice but that is where it ends. There was not a full roll of toilet paper in the bathroom when we arrived and not a single extra roll in the room, seriously WTH.  The rubber fittings on the shower handle were already coming off, when we showered with the door closed, a large amount of water leaked onto the bathroom floor-so I had to mop that up before drying my hair UGH, and there was not hook or anywhere to hang the hand towel. I know it is a little thing to complain about but it isn't an expansive vanity, with two people sharing the tiny sink leaving the hand towel on the counter top is gross. 

Fortunately we had carry on luggage but there is really nowhere to store luggage. I have been on cruise ships with better storage. There isn't a good spot to open your suitcase to remove clothes to hang up, I don't want to put my suitcase on the bed, and then there is no drawer space so you have to leave your carry-on with socks and what not on the case for the safe, It is fine not to have a closet but good grief, any decent wall organizer could handle some shelves or a drawer.

It was a lot of money to spend on a room that required so much extra effort to be comfortable. I am curious how well some of the fittings will hold up over time, some things seemed well thought out, others not so much. We didn't spend much time in the room, but I expected better. 

We checked out early and a much more pleasant man took our bags and arranged a car for the airport so we could sight see until it was time to go. That was the level of service I expected for our entire stay but didn't receive.

And after checkout-with no receipt I might add, I see the destination charge of $80 on my card for amenities I was never told about.  It is Hilton, they open up new hotels all the time, I get that technical issues occur, but better communication all around is desperately needed here so people don't feel cheated. So with feeling cheated, the glitchy system, and the other little things I don't think I would stay here again.  Another night here and I would probably have to go buy some toilet paper.

title: Tempo Hotel is awesome
text: We absolutely loved the Tempo Hotel!! The location is perfect, the rooms were clean & modern and the staff was amazing!! John was particularly helpful. We arrived well before checking time and he did a great job taking care of our things and giving us great advice about cool things to do until check in time. He was also helpful when we were leaving to coordinate our transportation. We are definitely going to stay here again!

title: Worth every penny .
text:
New Hotel . Perfect location . Family Friendly . Quick walk to all theatres and shows . View of Times Square . Rooms are small BUT the staff is worth the price of the room . We will be back because of the employees who worked so hard to make us feel at home . Everyone we came in contact with was kind , caring , and always ready to help. 
Trust me on this one . Look no further . This is the hotel for you !

title: Family-friendly in the heart of the action
text:
We don’t typically stay in Times Square when we come into the city, but decided to stay there this trip in order to stay in a newly opened hotel. We came with our two daughters and stayed for 5 nights in a two-queen city view room on the 30th floor.

CONS: the room was small with very little storage areas for suitcases and no drawers for clothes. (We knew we would be sacrificing room-size with our choice to stay here, but we’re disappointed with the lack of storage space). 

PROS: The fixtures in the room were beautiful and the beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was bright and surprisingly spacious. The view was great and you could crack the window to take in the sounds of the city, but when it was closed and the automatic shades were closed you couldn’t hear or see any sign of the activity below.

The location was very convenient to the theatre district and subway and the entrance being off on the side away from the main Times Square traffic made it easier to enter and exit the hotel . 

Bianca (one of the security team members), was one of the favorite parts of our stay. She always greeted us with a smile and provided an exemplary level of customer service to us every time we came in or left the hotel. She even gave our girls treat bags when we checked out.❤️ All other team members we encountered were friendly and helpful as well. 

If you are looking for a clean, updated hotel and don’t mind being in the middle of Times Square and small rooms, I would definitely recommend The Tempo!

title: Five start experience!
text: Just visited the Tempo Hilton hotel for drinks  with a group of my friends this past weekend and the staff and ambience was amazing! Everything was clean and immaculate and the security manager Jose Cordero went above and beyond with answering our questions ! Very knowledgeable and welcoming person.

title: Terrible
text: Worst service ever. Arrived at the hotel and informatic service wasn’t working. Been told to come back later. Came back twice in the afternoon with incredible line up waiting for help. Came back at 6 pm and room wasn’t ready. 20 minutes later, still waiting for my room, no word from desk, no help, nothing offered for inconvenience. Never seen such a bad service…!

title: Great service, clean/modern hotel
text: While I normally wouldn’t choose to stay in Times Square because of the crowds, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and service. Room was clean and modern, with a smart mirror that had built in Bluetooth speakers and a motion sensitive night light. Build in chargers all with USB-C. The staff was consistently professional and helpful, and Dino at the bell desk went above and beyond for me. He’s the man!!

title: Great experience. Amazing service.
text: Amazing service.   Very clean. Amazing view. Definitely it will be my first choice in New York City.    Kessi has amazing customer service. Very polite and very helpful.     She helped us with great suggestions   To make our trip memorable

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
What can I say but just WOW !! 
This hotel has amazing views of Times Square it’s close to everything. We went to see Back to the Future and it was less than a 10 mins walk. 
This hotel is super clean , everyone is so nice and what made it even better was seeing a familiar face we saw Sue !!!!! Who is just amazing I will be staying here again , Thank you Tempo !!

title: Location, location, location
text: If you want to see Broadway shows, you can't do better. The TKTS booth is a short stroll across the street. This being a brand new hotel, it has all the modern conveniences. Outlets and charging ports everywhere, motorized blinds and sheers, elevators you summon  by floor number with the screen indicating which one it will be. We never waited for an elevator. Our king room was small, but we're cruisers so that was no problem for us.  The bath was generously sized. The window was a stepped affair that gave you a fantastic view, better than a regular window. What can I say, our 4-night stay was a delight, start to finish.

title: A very special place in the heart of Time Square
text: From the moment the lobby doors opened, I knew this was going to be a special place.  The customer service was next level ( the people greeting you at the front door and elevators , the person who checked my luggage after checkout so that I could continue to explore the city ,  the bartender).   Taj checked me in and was amazing! She gave me a beautiful room with a spectacular view of Times Square and helped me with directions to my Fashion Week venues.  The room was gorgeous, modern and so comforatble!  I especially loved the automated blackout curtains that blocked out all the excitment below at bedtime.   The lounge/restaurant was a nice, comfortable place for lunch when I checked out.   I'll defintely be back.  It is an great hotel for business for leisure travel.

title: Best help and employee!
text: The best help and service at the restaurant. Kind, caring and personable.  Willing to give advice, extra help and cared about ensuring we had a great time.  She was spot on with suggestions, worked hard and was fun!

title: Great hotel and AMAZING staff
text: We loved everything about this hotel! Our room was amazing, the entire staff was so polite from check in to the hosts, housekeeping, bartenders, elevator peeps (yes....they have someone to get the next elevator for you!) Everyone! I have never had such 5 star service before.  Will definitely be coming back!

title: Disappointed
text:
Firstly the hotel entrance is nothing like your photograph! Although a great  location it is newly opened and still has a lot to learn
We arrived at 09:30 having disembarked from a cruise. No greeting and difficult to find help with our luggage. We had booked 3 nights. We were not checked in till 14:30 although check in is 15:00. Apparently we were upgraded. However I think they meant we were put in a room on an higher floor as I couldn’t imagine anything more basic in a room. It was of average size and the shower was excellent. However no shower cap provided. When the tissue box was empty it was not refilled even though I asked!! The communication is non existent. There is seldom any answer from reception. There are no instructions for the coffee machine or any information about facilities if they exist! A refrigerator is provided but empty. If we needed water we had to go to the lobby. There is no lounge just a restaurant where the service is non existent. No drinking glasses in the room although they were provided when we asked. 
There must be better hotels in New York for a similar price

title: Great experience in nyc!
text: Great experience - front desk personnel were amazing particularly Marta and David the Bellman.   Really nice time in nyc.  Room and hotel itself were great.  Some phone system problems while I was there but overall super pleasant time in nyc!    Go Tempo!

title: Coffee bar
text: Stayed at the Hotel in october for a couple of days visiting New York. Nice rooms and views.  When leaving on the last rainy day went the coffee bar where we had some coffee and a very good service from Amin

title: Come for the atmosphere but don’t miss the coffee bar.
text: Nice hotel but the coffee bar is a bonus.  Amin the bistro was quick and very personable.  Knows his coffees and keeps the line moving without feeling rushed. The atmosphere here is casual and very relaxing.  Rooms are a bit small but offer 2 queen beds which is a rare find in the theater district/ Time Square

title: Great place, great service!
text: Tempo by Hilton was the best place to stay! This is one of the newer hotels in Times Square and it’s so clean, sleek and modern. You enter the main lobby to check in on the 11th floor, and there’s also an onsite restaurant on the same floor. In terms of aesthetics, the lighting is very dim and the placement of the columns as you exit from ground level to the main lobby can be better but it doesn’t take away from everything else. From check in to check out, we had a great experience! When we visited the on site restaurant (Highball Times Square), Shenille and Henry Alvarado were so nice and helpful. They provided the absolute best service!  Check them out if you’re ever in the area. All of front desk professionals were a pleasure to deal with as well. Great hotel, great views from our room, great staff and the location is perfect. Will definitely stay again.

title: Location is tough to beat!
text:
Everything is brand new, the staff was friendly, the rooms were on the small size but well equipped and modern.

Close to all the best Broadway shows, 5 min from Harry Potter. 15 min walk to central park, right next to several subway lines including the one connecting to the free bus to go to Laguardia Airport

Perfect for few days or a weekend. Would go again.

title: Right off Times Square
text: Great hotel in a convenient location. Will be back the next time I’m in NYC! Clean rooms refreshed daily. Surprised at the quality of the restaurant as well. Excellent service in the restaurant, especially from Nur!

title: The best place to stay in the city!
text: We had a very pleasant stay. Everyone was so accommodating and most importantly to me they went above and beyond to greet us with a smile, they were so friendly!  Bianca with the security team was always there to greet us as we entered and exited the facility.  It was a refreshing and pleasant experience to meet so many  kind people in the city. This hotel has a great team of employees.  The rooms were clean, and room service never missed a beat.  They were always doing their job and offering a smile in passing.  The restaurant staff was great as well.

title: New Hotel still working out the flow of business
text:
The hotel is new, and location is great you will be in the heart of time square.

Pro-great location, clean, nice staff, fridge in the room, dog friendly, hardwood floors, nice view, and great shower
Cons- No ice machines on the floor you have to go to the bar to get ice.  No microwaves in the room.  Valet is a 3rd party don't use it if you have to because they can't bring your car back you will have to walk 6 blocks like we did to get our car with luggage.  It's not worth it!  They don't have a lot of food options in the hotel no hot breakfast.  But it's NY you can go outside the hotel to get food lots of great options.  Finally, they don't answer the front desk phone you have to go down there to speak with someone which was very frustrating; however, they seem extremely busy all the time at the front desk not sure why they don't answer though.  They didn't answer when I called prior to arrival.

title: Attentive Staff to Pricing/Value Concerns
text: Great new hotel; sleek and modern decor.. cozy and comfy rooms for solo or couples.  Great location off of broadway! However, I experienced unreasonable prices/service , particularly breakfast and coffee in the lobby canteen. I was given 1 slice of avocado toast and coffee for over $20usd. Really bizarre, 1 slice of toast (why not 2?) ?This seems obviously egregious for the value.  However- I happen to incidentally mention this to an evening bartender, Alex . Much to my surprise, Alex expressed concerned as to my experience and offered to get a manager for me to provide feedback. Glori, the manager came over and  to my surprise actually wanted to hear more. When i shared my view, she and Alex were open and accepting of the feedback. They then offered me a glass of wine as a hospitality gesture of appreciation. These two are on their game! Not sure if hotel will review the breakfast offering and prices, but much to my surprise- the staff was attentive to my stay experience and concern.

title: A wonderful weekend
text: Bianca in security was so incredibly helpful. She ensured our visit would be safe, secure and comfortable.  It was such a great time that I will definitely come back to visit again.  Thank you for an amazing weekend.

title: Worst ever
text:
The small details are what ruins a great stay or experience and unfortunately are what leaves the most memorable impression.

First, we arrived early around 11:30am and opted for valet parking and went to check-in and they said they would text or call when the room was ready maybe within an hour or two. Certainly did not expect to get a room since check-in is normally 4pm, and we wanted to walk to get lunch as well.

But we never ended up receiving a text at all. So didn't go back to the hotel until 3:30pm because of that. We had to have our toddler sleep in the stroller while we pushed him around in the crowd.

Then, now when checking out, for the first time I hear they need an hour notice for valet car retrieval. Well nobody told me that when I arrived. So I'm sitting here waiting endlessly for my vehicle and have a long drive back to Canada and way behind schedule because of the lack of communication.

Why don't you even just put that on the valet ticket or something. So that it's in writing.

We were all packed before 9am, and walked over to grab a coffee at McDonald's before checking out and asking for the car. Had we known, we would have obviously asked for the vehicle earlier.

What a complete waste of my time. There are so many positives to the hotel, but they didn't earn my time for that because I have to spend it on writing the above instead.

Room 2321 (Oct 8 to 9).

title: Thank you for the experience
text: The view is awesome, the bathroom is luxurious, the bed was so comfy, the room was cozy, I like the lights and the curtness were electronic, MAKE SOURE TO GIVE KESSY A RAISE please she was so nice to me

title: Tempo staff make the experience
text: What a wonderful experience. Excellent location. Central and can walk to all the theaters and fun shops. Shout out to Brianna and Marcell for amazing customer service. They elevated our experience with kindness and care

title: Setting the Tempo in the center of everything
text:
The staff had it all together even just having been open for a few weeks. Everyone was friendly, helpful and welcoming from the Valet (wish I could remember his name, his daughter just graduated college in PA with a degree in architecture), bell staff (David and Jose), front desk  and the cafe staff(Henry and Chelsy). Please note that the entrance and where you will park for the valet is under construction, so there were only 2 spots right by the door, so be prepared for some NY style driving. This also causes for some back up with the bell staff, as it takes 1 hour notice for you to receive your car. 
I appreciated security at the entrance door and that the for the elevator to your rooms you enter your room number before entering, so not everyone else knows who is getting off at what floor. 
Tha main lobby has amazing Times Square views, as do many of the bedrooms. Rooms are standard NYC size, but have everything you need to store your items, including a mini fridge, as well as black out shades, since the lights in Time Square makes it daylight 24/7.  The bathroom was large with a mirror (and lighting around it that could be dimmed), a step in shower with a rainfall shower head, and bulk toiletry dispensers.
Cafe had a few grab and go items, but could use more variety.
The hotel itself is located near everything you could want from restaurants, the theatre district, souvenir and chocolate store shopping. Would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

title: A New York experience must!
text:
The hotel was super beautiful. The bed was sooo comfortable and the bathroom was state of the art! The one most amazing thing was when we came in the room and it a welcome to my husband on the television!!! 
The team members Laura and Bianca in security were extremely friendly and wonderful! Their attitudes were so welcoming and made us feel at home!! We really appreciated them, but all of the staff was excellent! The restaurant in the hotel was good just not enough selections on the menu for guest who may not want to go out to eat. Overall the next time we’re in New York we definitely be back at the Tempo by Hilton!

title: A wonderful stay
text: I had a great stay at this hotel, lovely room and staff. I wanted to say how helpful the bell staff were - Jose, Kingsley, Kevin were. They helped me with all my bags and made sure I got taxi’s and were very friendly.

title: Times Square Gem!
text:
I recently stayed at the Tempo by Hilton off of Times Square and really enjoyed my overall visit. The hotel is very chic, and the rooms are excellent. I stayed in a king room. From the shower and bathroom to the bedding, flatscreen, automatic shades, this was by far one of the nicest rooms I’ve stayed in for the money.

The only thing at this very time that I can say that could’ve been better (unfortunately cannot be avoided because of construction) was the valet service. Now this is not a reflection on the staff of the valet, but just the overall availability of space to be able to pull your vehicle into valet in the first place, considering that , the front of the building off of 7th Ave is under complete construction. I had to circle around the building twice, which took me nearly 45 minutes until I was able to finally contact the hotel and have a valet attendant meet me out there. The service from them again was excellent, It was just the process that could’ve been better, I would assume that it will be better once the construction is no longer there.  My advice in the meantime is to make sure that you pull up to the hotel traveling eastbound on 47th St. this is where you will find the entrance to the hotel currently as well as the valet service.

If you choose not to use the valet service, my advice would be to research the multiple parking garages that are in the area. I use Google maps, for example and found multiple garages. However, there is one garage on 47th St. that was nearly the same price as it would have been for me to valet, which is ultimately what I did. The next time I go, I will look for the icon parking garages, which are all over the entire area and only a few blocks away for about half the price, if you don’t mind walking this is your best option and guess what you’re gonna be walking anyways so why not?

Overall, this is a five star hotel and I know you will enjoy the day very much.

title: Amazing new hotel
text: Very impressed with this new hotel. Staff were wonderful and very helpful. Door staff were amazing. This hotel is right at the north end of Times Square and central to many attractions. Looking forward to coming back.

title: Good location for Broadway shows
text: We stayed for 2 nights, Friday and Saturday, to see Broadway plays and enjoy NY.  The location was excellent, we walked to our shows, to Grand Central and across the street to the Hershey Store.  The hotel was well staffed, which is unusual these days.  We were able to check our luggage with the bellman, as did many guests.  Lobby check-in was smooth and as a diamond Hilton member I was given credits that covered breakfast the next morning.  The dining area is casual, you place your order with attendant and pick up from counter when ready.  There is also prepared food such as yogurt, breakfast sandwiches, soft drinks.  The room was a 2 queen style.  As with all NYC rooms, there isn't much extra space but the room was set up comfortably and very clean.  The bathroom was large with a walk-in shower.  There was a water-bottle filling station in the hallway, but the water was not cold.  I would stay here again and recommend.

title: Thanks Bianca

title: Perfect..
text: I want Tempo by  Hilton to be my forever hotel. ❤️ I absolutely loved my security team. Bianca went above and beyond.. title: Good hotel but needs some improvement
text:
I have stayed two weeks at the hotel. The rooms are loaded with the latest features, though the rooms are small. The staff is friendly, especially the security, who make you feel welcome every time. 
I was not too fond of the breakfast options for the room's price. It should have at least a decent buffet menu, and I ran into multiple guests who didn't appreciate it either. The staff said they are trying a new takeaway concept. Not of my liking. Otherwise good location close to everything around it.

title: Absolutely Incredible
text:
From start to finish, our stay was amazing. This was our first trip to New York, travelling from the UK, and I was so worried as I had read so many reviews on the accommodation in NYC. I can honestly say, this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. 

The staff were so friendly and attentive, the layout was fabulous and the whole place was spotlessly clean with modern decor. 

The location is superb -  walk out of the main door and you are at the red stairs on Times Square. We were able to walk to Central Park, Empire State Building, the Financial Distract and even Brooklyn. The view from the room was breathtaking. 

Thank you so much Tempo by Hilton for making our first trip to New York so memorable. We can not wait to return.

title: Amazing stay with the family!
text:
I just want to take the time to acknowledge and appreciate my stay at Tempo.  I used my one free night, and when I looked it up online there was two  queens but when I called in, it was gone and the person attending the desk at the time told the agent I would likely have to pay the difference but would need to speak to the manager to confirm. The manager called back the Hilton agent noting they can upgrade me to the 2 queens room with no additional charge. I was super appreciative of this and my family very much impressed and loved the room.
Every single staff at Tempo were so kind and amazing. They showed true example of hospitality. I received a text right when I flew in to check in to see if we are good with our check in. I even texted them when we were running late. Valet were kind as well and we kept changing up our pick up time for valet too but they were super accommodating throughout. 
Once we arrived, they acknowledged me as diamond which was nice. Again the staff for check in, the luggage storage, restaurant and valet all were nice and friendly to everyone.
The hotel is literally steps away from Times Square so the location is honestly great if you want to explore the times square area. 
The only con I would say would be the price of breakfast as I find it a bit on the pricey side. While do I get $18.00  daily credit up to 2 people, it still barely covered the costs of what we ordered. I do appreciate the staff were able to make some of the meals vegetarian friendly as well but again did find it all more on the expensive side of things. 
Overall still would give it 5/5 as everyone was so friendly and welcoming.

title: Great quality service and professionalism
text: This is an amazing place to go eat and relax. Great service, very professional, and the food is spectacular. title: Designed beautifully
text:
Wow - it’s rare to have such a wonderful and seamless stay in NYC but this was perfect. Stayed here for US Open as its convenient to both 7 train and MSG. It was a bit hard to find at first but we’ll worth it and pleasantly greeted every step of the way. Times Square is still an awful place to walk through but if you go east to Bryant park it’s much quieter. Having the lobby on 11th floor also helps keep non wanted guests out of lobby - there was lots of friendly security though

Room was excellent and brand new, nice shower, one push blackout drapes and comfy beds. No ESPN but I think that’s Spectrums fault

In the morning we got a very expensive breakfast in the lobby (delicious bluestone coffee) and if you’re Hilton Gold you can get credits for food. Plus they have a cold water refilling station which is plus for those hot days

Only recommendations - maybe more soundproofing in hallway, bigger baggage hold area as it was overflowing into hallway.

title: Best hotel in Times Square
text:

Best,

Alexandra Benjamin

title: Top Notch Service!
text:

He acknowledged my birthday and the fact that I was a Diamond Hilton member. From there, Shy continued with the great service! Everything was top tier in the hotel. The view is AMAZING. I'm not taking off a star for it though because literally the experience was top tier. I am already looking to book again for my partner's birthday in October. 

Trust me when I say, you should definitely stay here. Even the security gave great service. (Shoutout to Bianca) I'm pregnant and I was able to walk to and from everything I wanted to experience. text:

It’s close to everything and even at 5am looking out of the window there is so much to see . 

We choose a room with a peloton - the room was small but that’s typical for the area . 

The concierge couldn’t answer any tourist questions saying the hotel was new so no one would be able to help -  I was only asking how to get to the train station .

For the location though I would stay again . The lifts are super quick !

title: My new "Go To" in NYC
text: I’ll start by saying that I’m an Honors Diamond Member, have traveled extensively, and don’t have the time to post reviews for all the properties I stay at. I reserve the reviews for the really good or really bad experiences.  This is one of the really good experiences.  Not even good… legitimately perfect.  I am unable to find one single fault with my 4 night stay.  The hotel is brand new, only open 2 weeks, and the rooms and public areas and accommodations are spotless and well appointed.  The rooms (by NYC standards) are fairly spacious, offer motorized shades, wireless phone chargers, rain showers, bluetooth speakers, etc.  The bed was more comfortable than any Hilton property I've stayed in, granted I was probably the first or second person to ever have slept in it.  One of the biggest complaints of travelers staying in larger city hotels is the wait for an elevator.  This hotel has 3 from the street level to the lobby (11th floor) and another 5 or 6 that go to guest floors.  I never waited more than 20-30 seconds for an elevator.  If anything, they're too fast.. by the time you get to them the doors are closing... This needs to be improved but is a small tweak.  The biggest strength of this property is not the public areas or accommodations, it's the staff... The words "no" or "maybe" are not in their vocabulary, the answer was "absolutely" or "my pleasure" to any and every request I had.  I'd recognize the shining stars, but to be honest, I literally did not come across an employee who was not friendly or helpful.  The only area for improvement would be the restaurant... Everything I had was outstanding, but the menu was extremely limited and room service was not offered.  Bottom line... Great property and I'll choose it every time I get the opportunity.

title: Upscale hotel in the heart of Times Square with amazing friendly service
text: Our stay at the Tempo by Hilton was absolutely wonderful. We were looking for a Hilton brand hotel which offered two queen beds within walking distance of the Broadway theaters, and we were thrilled to find this brand new hotel. Beautiful and quality furnishings, with an international and luxury feel, and a friendly greeting from every single hotel staff member we encountered. We were a little worried about the street noise since the hotel is located right in the heart of Times Square, but we really didn't hear very  much from outside. The elevators were FAST, and the fitness center is outfitted with very nice equipment (including Peloton bikes). The queen beds did not appear to be the full 60 inches standard width to us, but we slept just fine. The only complaint we have is the costly parking rate: valet parking only, $85 daily rate for a sedan, $95 daily rate for an SUV.

title: Perfect place to stay in Time Square, with excellent service.
text:
So this hotel has only been open for one week, and it is officially my new favorite hotel in NYC. I had no idea it was the former Doubletree Time Square until I arrived. So if you want Time Square access, it doesn’t get any better! They completed a $2 billion reno and it shows. The rooms are much more European in their feel (very modern, small, and efficient) but they have everything you need including a small refrigerator and coffee machine. The mattress and bedding are high quality, and I loved the different pillow options included on the bed. The towels were super plush - I’d love some of these at home. The rain shower and detachable wand worked great, and great water pressure and temperature. The lighting made it easy to work, and I loved the “relax” option for more subtle lighting in the evening. The shades and drapes are automatic - I used both given the lights from Time Square pouring in. Interestingly, there was not much street noise, which was great. I had a room on the 25th and 17th floor (I extended my stay) and they had the same layout.

What impressed me the most was the level of service that I received EVERYWHERE in the hotel. From the gentlemen at the check in, to the folks in the restaurant, to the security staff, to the ladies who checked me out, to the bellman at the door, everyone was genuinely kind and seemed to care about the quality of my stay. When I checked out the 2nd time, they helped me pack my pizza (John’s on 44th never fails!), found more of the Bluestone Lane drinks I fell in love with to take home, and arranged for my transportation to the airport. Every single person smiled - I travel a crap ton, so a smile means everything to me; and everyone delivered. The only small mishap was in the restaurant - I ordered the pork belly and it was not hot when it arrived. The server apologized, took the plate and returned with a new plate of perfectly cooked pork belly - and it was DELICIOUS! Again, the server clearly cared about my meal and my experience. 

The entrance is actually on 47th right now, as they are completing the Broadway entrance. I received a text to let me know that just prior to my arrival, which was nice. 

In short, for the location, the service, and the quality of the room/hotel amenities, this will remain where I choose to stay when I’m in the City! Now… if they had a hot Doubletree chocolate chip cookie… Lol!
